text.p: Following is a summary of expected new issues in the international primary debt market.
The list was compiled from information provided by borrowers, banks mandated to lead manage the issues and other primary market sources. All terms and conditions are indicative.
Details of upcoming bond issues can be telephoned into the London newsroom on +44 171 542 8863
(OFFICIAL indicates confirmed by borrower)
DOLLARS
+ FANNIE MAE, TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY eyeing 10-year global bonds.
+ FIRST CHICAGO, self-led 7 or 10-yr asset-backed global FRN
+ FRANCE TELECOM, mooted for September
+ HOUSEHOLD FINANCE,up to $1.0 bln asset-backed bond,Merrill
+ ITALY, possible large 10-year fixed-rate Euro or global
+ Japan's KANSAI AIRPORT, $200 million 10yr Eurobond, +30 b.p.
+ NORDBANKEN, $100 million subordinated step-up perpetual FRN, five-year call, J.P. Morgan, launch in August
+ ONTARIO, up to $2.0 billion of five or 10-year, pricing at around 30 b.p. over on a five-year, mooted for September
+ ORCHID SECURITIES, $400 million asset-backed FRN,Merrill Lynch
+ PUMA MANAGEMENT (Australia) planning three-tranche mortgage-backed FRN for $400 million by end Q3 via JP Morgan
+ SPV RESIDENTIAL REINSURANCE LTD, $500 million, Merrill Lynch, first public bond whose principal payments dependent on losses incurred by insurance group USAA.
+ SPAIN, up to $2.0 bln 5-yr bond, possibly an FRN, late Q3
+ SWEDEN, five-year FRN
+ TOKYO ELECTRIC POWER, $1.0 billion 10-year bond (on hold)
+ TMCC, five-year Euro-Asian bond
+ City of YOKOHAMA, $300 million 10-year, Bank of Tokyo
MARKS
+ AKB PRIVAT UND HANDELSBANK, August 20, 250 million mark five-year FRN via Bayerische Landesbank
+ BANKGESELLSCHAFT, one bln mark five-year Eurobond via C.S. First Boston Effectenbank and J.P. Morgan.
+ France's CADES, long-dated mark issue, $1.0 bln global
+ CHUGOKU ELECTRIC, 350 million marks via Commerzbank
+ CITIBANK, DEAN WITTER, securitised mark bonds
+ DEUTSCHE BAHN, one bln mark 10-year offering
+ KFW, jumbo seven-year deal with single digit spread
+ OKB, 500 million mark five-year
+ SUEDWESTLB, jumbo five-year mark deal
OTHER CURRENCIES
+ AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, 2.0 billion French franc bond via Societe Generale (OFFICIAL)
+ DOCKLANDS LIGHT RAILWAY, 150 million stg 20-year securitised bond, BZW
+ FANNIE MAE, eyeing French franc sector for later this year
+ ITALY, debut French franc bond, up to 7.0 billion Ffr
+ Britain's STAGECOACH HOLDINGS, set to launch largest asset-backed sterling bonds in September, 535 million stg securitisation of train leases, UBS
+ NORTHERN ROCK, LLOYDS and ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND in stg.
+ ONTARIO, BRITISH COLUMBIA eyeing Canadian dollars
+ QUEBEC PROVINCE, 10-year French franc bond possible. Also looking at dollars.
+ WORLD BANK, inaugural Ecu bond
EMERGING MARKETS
+ Brazil's ACESITA (private steel mill), $150 million eight-year Eurobond via ABN AMRO, September roadshow (OFFICIAL)
+ ARGENTINA, 500-750 million mark 3-5 yr Eurobond, could increase three-year deal launched in May via CSFB Effectenbank
+ Mexico's BANCO BITAL,$100 million asset-backed 3-yr FRN,SBCW
+ BANCO REAL, via West Merchant Bank
+ BANK CENTRAL ASIA PT, $150 million 6-yr FRN, put,call at three years, LTCB Asia
+ BANK RAKYAT INDONESIA, $70 million five-year FRN
+ Poland's BRE, Bank Rozwoju Exportu, $100 million three-year FRN, below 85 bp over Libor, September (OFFICIAL)
+ Lebanon's BYBLOS BANK,up to $100 million, SBC Warburg and Lebanon Invest
+ CENTRAL COSTANERA (Argentina), $75 million three-yr, Chase
+ Brazil's CESP to launch more bonds this year to lengthen maturity of short-term debt. Considering global bond (OFFICIAL)
+ Brazilian CEVAL, $100 million, Citibank
+ COFIDE, Peru's Corporacion Financiera de Desarrollo first $50 million of $300 EMTN programme via Merrill Lynch
+ COUNTRYWIDE CORP, Hong Kong, $150 million 5-yr, FRN debut, UBS
+ CROATIA, $250 million 5-yr, Libor plus 230 b.p., after rating
+ ELETROPAULO, Sao Paulo's state energy company, Eurobond debut in Q2 with a $420 million deal at 550-650 b.p. over.
+ National Bank of HUNGARY $500 million benchmark global DMG/ Merrill on hold until September.
+ ISRAEL, $750 million EMTN programme, $200 million Eurobond in fourth quarter of 1996, Merrill Lynch (OFFICIAL)
+ KAZAKHSTAN, plans a $100 million Eurobond by September, lead manager ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett (OFFICIAL)
+ KOREA FIRST BANK, $100 million FRN due 1999, Goldman Sachs
+ MOSCOW, $300 million three-year Eurobond (OFFICIAL). Q4
+ MULIA LAND PT, $200 million two-tranche bond, three- and five-year tranches, launch after August 7, JP Morgan (OFFICIAL)
+ PERU, $75 million before year-end (OFFICIAL)
+ Czech Republic's RADEGAST, 70 million mark five-year Eurobond via Nomura with expected 110 b.p. over Bunds.
+ India's RELIANCE INDUSTRIES, 150 million stg, 10-year bond, +220-240 bp, HSBC Markets.
+ ROMANIA and the CZECH REPUBLIC, eyeing marks
+ RUSSIA, Up to $500 million in Oct via JP Morgan/SBC Warburg. Waiting for ratings (OFFICIAL). Could launch unrated issue
+ SOUTH AFRICA, eyeing the mark and Yankee sectors, 5-yr mark deal at 175-185 b.p. over possible, no mandate yet awarded
+ THAILAND, $200 million FRN at five years, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, price talk Libor plus 5/7 b.p. all in.
+ THAI FARMERS BANK, U.S. dollar subordinated issue, Merrill
+ Argentina's TRANSENER, $85 million three-year bond around low 300s over Treasuries, CS First Boston.
+ TURKEY, 50 billion yen seven-year Samurai bond
+ VIETNAM, $100-$150 million, Merrill Lynch and Nomura after rating, Q4 1996 possible
+ VENEZUELA, waiting for approval to launch 750 million mark seven-year bond. WestLB lead (OFFICIAL)
